hanzi-su-wiki:
賦

Значения

Налог, подать, взнос

Мнемоника

Платить 貝 налоги под угрозой применения военной силы 武.

Варианты

赋

heisig_chinese_memo: A military warrior stands guard at a bridge collecting shells as a levy for any who want to pass.
heisig_constituent: levy, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, warrior, one, stop, footprint, arrow
heisig_story: A certain portion of shells (money) is collected by the warrior from the local villages as he passes through to defray the costs of keeping the land safe, and this is called a levy.
myStory: государство платит воину, при чем тут стихи
Keyword_KANJIDIC: levy, ode, prose, poem, tribute, installment
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: сбор, ода, проза, стихотворение, дань, рассрочка
koohiiStory1: A warrior stands guard at a bridge collecting shells as a levy for any who want to pass.
koohiiStory2: Drove my Chevy to the levy but the levy was dry. And those good old warrior boys, drinking whiskey and rye, said pay up the clams or you´ll die. Pay up the clams or you´ll die....

Ru_trainchinese: fù: (глаг/сущ) облагать (налогом), взимать (подати); давать, даровать; слагать (стихи); поземельный налог, подати, оброк (в древние времена); фу (литературный жанр)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the military (武) shellfish (貝) administers the levy
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A military clam collects the levy at the bridge entrance.
humanum_full_description_en:
Inscriptions from " Bei " from " Wu ", " Wu " is a sound symbol, from " Bei " means related to property, from " Wu " because the tax was originally to pay for army expenses (see Dai Jiaxiang). "Zhou Li. Xia Guan. "Da Sima": "Fan order fu, based on land and people." Zheng Xuan's note: "Fu, for military users." "Shu Wen": "Fu, Lian Ye. Cong Bei, Wu Sheng."

Bronze writing is used as the name of a person. See also the term "Chu Fu", "Shangshu Dazhuan" as "Xu Fu", "Poetry. Daya. "Mian" is "Shufu", which means auxiliary minister, Mao Gongding: "Yi Xiaoda Chu Fu", which means governing and leading officials of all sizes.

" Fu " means collection and taxation. It is found in the Chu Bamboo Slips of the Warring States Period, "Shangbo Chu Bamboo Book II. "Rong Chengshi": "No Fu in Guanshi".
humanum_full_description:
金文從「貝」從「武」，「武」是聲符，從「貝」表示與財物有關，從「武」是因為賦稅最初是為了支付軍隊開支(參戴家祥)。《周禮．夏官．大司馬》：「凡令賦，以地與民制之。」鄭玄注：「賦，給軍用者也。」《說文》：「賦，斂也。从貝，武聲。」

　　金文用作人名，又見「楚賦」一詞，《尚書大傳》作「胥賦」，《詩．大雅．緜》作「疏附」，表示輔助之臣，毛公鼎：「藝小大楚賦」，表示治理、領導大小官吏。

　　「賦」表示賦斂、賦稅，見於戰國楚簡，《上博楚竹書二．容成氏》：「關市無賦」。

金文從「 貝 」從「 武 」，「 武 」是聲符，從「 貝 」表示與財物有關，從「 武 」是因為賦稅最初是為了支付軍隊開支(參戴家祥)。《周禮．夏官．大司馬》：「凡令賦，以地與民制之。」鄭玄注：「賦，給軍用者也。」《說文》：「賦，斂也。从貝，武聲。」 金文用作人名，又見「楚賦」一詞，《尚書大傳》作「胥賦」，《詩．大雅．緜》作「疏附」，表示輔助之臣，毛公鼎：「藝小大楚賦」，表示治理、領導大小官吏。 「 賦 」表示賦斂、賦稅，見於戰國楚簡，《上博楚竹書二．容成氏》：「關市無賦」。
Inscriptions from " Bei" from " Wu", " Wu" is a sound symbol, from " Bei" means related to property, from " Wu" because the tax was originally to pay for army expenses (see Dai Jiaxiang). "Zhou Li. Xia Guan. "Da Sima": "Fan order fu, based on land and people." Zheng Xuan's note: "Fu, for military users." "Shu Wen": "Fu, Lian Ye. Cong Bei, Wu Sheng." Bronze writing is used as the name of a person. See also the term "Chu Fu", "Shangshu Dazhuan" as "Xu Fu", "Poetry. Daya. "Mian" is "Shufu", which means auxiliary minister, Mao Gongding: "Yi Xiaoda Chu Fu", which means governing and leading officials of all sizes. " Fu" means collection and taxation. It is found in the Chu Bamboo Slips of the Warring States Period, "Shangbo Chu Bamboo Book II. "Rong Chengshi": "No Fu in Guanshi".

賦字的基本解释

賦
fù
见“赋”。

賦字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fù］
［《廣韻》方遇切，去遇，非。］
“赋1”的繁体字。
(1)田地税。泛指赋税。
(2)徭役；兵役。
(3)指服役。
(4)兵，军队。
(5)征收或缴纳赋税。
(6)授，给与。
(7)天资；天赋。
(8)贡士。古代向朝廷推举人才。语出《汉书·晁错传》：“今臣窋等乃以臣錯充賦，甚不稱明詔求賢之意。”颜师古注：“如淳曰：'猶言備數也。'臣瓚曰：'充賦，此錯之謙也，云如賦謂也。'”
(9)贡品。
(10)吟诵或创作诗歌。
(11)《诗经》六义之一。是一种直陈其事的表现手法。
(12)文体名。是韵文和散文的综合体。讲究词藻、对偶、用韵。最早以“赋”名篇的为战国荀况，今实存《礼赋》、《知赋》等五篇。后盛行于汉、魏、六朝。
(13)通“敷”。铺展；分布。
(14)通“敷”。颁布；颁行。

賦字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　賦； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1210第03
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?方遇切，音付。責取也。【說文】斂也。【爾雅·釋言】賦，量也。【註】賦稅，所以評量。【揚子·方言】賦，動也。【註】賦斂，所以擾動民也。【書·禹貢】厥賦惟上上錯。【傳】賦，謂土地所生，以供天子。【周禮·天官·大宰】以八則治都鄙，五曰賦貢，以馭其用。【註】賦，口率出泉也。【前漢·?法志】畿方千里有稅有賦，稅以足食，賦以足兵。【註】賦，謂發賦斂財也。　又【韻會】稟受也，給與也。【禮·中庸】天命之謂性。【註】性者，人所稟受。【朱傳】氣以成形，而理亦賦焉。　又布也。【詩·大雅】明命使賦。【傳】賦，布也。【箋】使羣臣施布之也。　又鋪?也。【詩·周南·關雎序】詩有六義，二曰賦。【疏】賦之言鋪，直鋪?今之政敎善惡。【班固·兩都賦序】賦者古詩之流。　又貢士曰賦。【前漢·鼂錯傳】乃以臣錯充賦。【註】如淳曰：猶言備數也。臣瓚曰：云如賦調也。

賦字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形

暂无。

Endow
Basic explanation of words
Endow
fù
See "Fu".
Endow
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［fù］
["Guangyun" Fang Yuqie, go to meet, non. ]
The traditional characters of "Fu 1".
(1) Land tax. Refers generally to taxes.
(2) Military service; military service.
(3) Refers to service.
(4) Soldiers, army.
(5) Collect or pay taxes.
(6) Grant, give.
(7) Talent; talent.
(8) Gong Shi. In ancient times, talents were recommended to the court. From the "Han Shu·Chao Cuo Zhuan": "Today's ministers, etc. are used to fill the fus by mistakes of the ministers, and it is not called the imperial edict to seek the right." "Chen Zan said: "Fulfilling the Fu, this is the wrong one, and Yun Rufu means it.""
(9) Tribute.
(10) Recite or write poetry.
(11) One of the six meanings of "The Book of Songs". It is a way of expressing the truth.
(12) The name of the style. It is a synthesis of verse and prose. Pay attention to words, antithesis, and rhyme. The earliest titled "Fu" is Xun Kuang in the Warring States Period, and now there are five chapters including "Ritual Fu" and "Zhi Fu". Later prevailed in the Han, Wei and Six Dynasties.
(13) Through "application". Spread; distribution.
(14) Through "application". Promulgate; promulgate.
Endow

[Biography] Fu, which is born from the land for the emperor. 【Zhou Li·Tian Guan·Da Zai】The eight rules are used to rule all people, and the fifth is to pay tribute to control their use. [Note] Fu, mouth rate is also out of spring. [Previous Han·? Fazhi] There are taxes and levies in Jifang thousands of miles, taxes are enough to eat, and they are given to soldiers. 【Note】Fu means to make a fortune.　[Yunhui] Receiving and giving. 【Rite·Medium】The destiny of nature is sex. 【Note】Sexual people are endorsed by people. [Zhu Chuan] Qi is formed, and Li is also endowed with Yan.　It's also clothed. [Poetry·Daya] Mingming Shifu. [Biography] Fu, cloth also. 【Jian】To make the group of ministers also give.　 Shop again? Also. 【Poetry·Zhou Nan·guanju preface】Poetry has six meanings, and the second is Fu. 【Sparse】Publish the words of Fu, straight out? Today's politics teaches good and evil. 【Banggu·Liangdu Fu Preface】The composer's ancient poems.　Gong Shi said Fu. 【Previous Han·Miao Biography】It was a mistake to fill the gift with the minister.
